Interface_name: WebSocket Client-side by using websocket - client in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a WebSocket client class for chat functionality that handles connection, message sending/receiving, and error handling with proper thread management.

Class Description: ChatNewWebSocket is a WebSocket client implementation for chat applications that manages WebSocket connections, message queuing, and event callbacks in separate threads. It provides methods for starting/stopping connections, sending messages, and handling WebSocket events.

Attributes:
- _parent: [weakref.ref] - Weak reference to the parent object for callback handling
- ws: [WebSocketApp] - WebSocketApp instance for managing the connection
- _inQueue: [Queue] - Thread-safe queue for outgoing messages
- sendThread: [Thread] - Thread for processing outgoing messages

Methods:
- __init__(parent) -> None - Initializes the WebSocket client with parent reference and starts send thread
- parent() -> object - Property to dereference the weak parent reference
- Stop() -> None - Stops the send thread by putting empty string in queue
- SendDataRun() -> None - Thread target function that processes outgoing messages from queue
- _SendData(data) -> None - Internal method to send data through WebSocket and emit appropriate events
- _Send(msg) -> None - Internal method to send raw message through WebSocket
- Send(data) -> None - Public method to queue data for sending
- on_message(ws, message) -> None - Callback for received WebSocket messages
- on_error(ws, error) -> None - Callback for WebSocket errors
- on_close(ws) -> None - Callback for WebSocket connection close
- on_open(ws) -> None - Callback for WebSocket connection open
- Start(roomId, token, url) -> None - Starts WebSocket connection with given parameters in new thread
- Close() -> None - Closes active WebSocket connection
